question: In which country was the epicentre of the 6.1 magnitude earthquake that affected Delhi in December
explanation: An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 on the Richter scale struck the Hindu Kush region. The quake originated north of Kabul in Afghanistan. The depth of the quakeâ€™s origin was 212 km. The tremors were felt in Delhi NCR, J&K, Rajasthan, Himachal Pradesh, Haryana and Punjab.
